Package controllers

Class ShowingController

java.lang.Object
controllers.ShowingController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ShowingController extends Object implements Serializable
Controller class that handles the creation, deletion, and modification of Showings for Movies.
See Also:

      public void printCinema(Showing showing)

      Parameters:
      showing - a Showing object

    • setSeatingForShowing

      public Seat setSeatingForShowing(Showing showing)
      It takes in a showing object, prints the seating plan of the showing, prompts the user to enter a seat position, validates the seat position, sets the occupancy of the seat to true and returns the seat object
      Parameters:
      showing - Showing object
      Returns:
      The seat object that was just set to occupied.

    • validateSeatSelection

      public boolean validateSeatSelection(Showing showing, String seatPos)
      Validate that the seat selected is not EMPTY (invalid) and not occupied Format of seatPos is Letter-Number Row and col cannot exceed cinema's dimensions (seat exists in the cinema)
      Parameters:
      showing - the showing object
      seatPos - "A1"
      Returns:
      A boolean value.

    • findSeatIndexByRowAndCol

      public int findSeatIndexByRowAndCol(Showing showing, int row, int col)
      It finds the index of a seat in the seating plan of a cinema, given the row and column of the seat. Returns -1 if no seat exists at that specified row and col. If there's a 2-seater from A1-A2, this method returns same index for both A1 and A2. The row and col arguments would already have been validated when this method runs, such that seat will always be found. -1 should never be returned.
      Parameters:
      showing - The showing object that the seat is in.
      row - The row of the seat to be found
      col - The column of the seat to be found.
      Returns:
      The index of the seat in the seating plan.

    • verifyNoShowingOverlaps

      public boolean verifyNoShowingOverlaps(Cinema cinema, Showing showing)
      It checks that the showing to be added does not overlap with any other showings in the cinema
      Parameters:
      cinema - Cinema object
      showing - the showing to be added
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value.
